Package controller

Class MatrixController

java.lang.Object
controller.MatrixController
public class MatrixController extends Object
Main class of the application responsible for handling data received from IO-service and directing the model.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Bartek

    • selectOperation

      private MatrixOperationTypeEnum selectOperation(String input)
      Deprecated.
      Method used to select operation. Original version with the use of static enum class methode
      Parameters:
      input - String containing operation name
      Returns:
      MatrixOperationTypeEnum element corresponding to the input

    • selectOperation2

      private MatrixOperationTypeEnum selectOperation2(String input)
      Method used to select operation. Proper version without the use of static methods.
      Parameters:
      input - String containing the user input operation name (can be incorrect)
      Returns:
      MatrixOperationTypeEnum element corresponding to the input

    • prepareSquareMatrix

      private Matrix prepareSquareMatrix(String dimension)
      Method that prepares the square matrix (creates new object, sets its dimension) If the input data is incorrect, the program will ask the user to correct it until it is.
      Parameters:
      dimension - String containing the matrix dimension specified by user input (can be incorrect)
      Returns:
      Matrix class object

    • prepareMatrix

      private Matrix prepareMatrix(String numberOfColumns, String numberOfRows)
      Method that prepares the matrix (creates new object, sets its dimensions). If the input data is incorrect, the program will ask the user to correct it until it is.
      Parameters:
      numberOfColumns - String containing the number of columns specified by user input (can be incorrect)
      numberOfRows - String containing the number of rows specified by user input (can be incorrect)
      Returns:
      Matrix class object

    • run

      public void run(String[] args)
      The main controller method, used to coordinate View and Model classes and their methods.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments
